comments: If I open the help contents and access this Tomcat page via: Web Application Development Users Guide Using the server tools Application testing and publishing Creating, editing, and deleting servers Creating a server ...Apache Tomcat it displays: An error occured while processing the requested document: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The element type "div" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "". at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.DOMParser.parse(DOMParser.java:264) at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.DocumentBuilderImpl.parse(DocumentBuilderImpl.java:292) .... I have DITA 1.2.2 running in my development environment in an effort to provide some additional Tomcat documentation. Simply regenerating the tomcat.html from the tomcat.dita file appears to fix this problem.
The html that's there now is a bit of a mess (although it does render ok in a local browser). I've rerun the build and I'll try it in a driver.
I've rerun the transform and tested my update in a build and it works. Dropped to 201 and head.
Verified using WTP build M-2.0.1-200708162247.  Thanks.

traces.message: The element type "div" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "".
